author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

@giordano this commit was desired to be an update. However, at the moment I committed and mentioned the Registrator, it marked this as a new package (and it will have conflicts, as you can see above). I find it happened because the first version was in the queue to be merged after the mandatory 3 days period, and the Registrator may have not found it. I don't know if the bot will have problems merging the package, but in case of having, it shouldn't be better to delete it, so I can call the Registrator again?
I recommend you do downgrade the version number to v0.2.0, so that's consecutive to the only currently registered version, and trigger registration again.
